snippet: Political analysts and Jewish leaders say Eric Cantor’s Jewish faith did not play a role in his electoral loss. But his opponent, David Brat, had a particular appeal among Christian conservatives.
abstract: Political analysts and Jewish leaders say Eric Cantor’s Jewish faith did not play a role in his primary loss to upstart David Brat; analysts, however, do emphasize that Brat, who has a divinity degree and often invokes God in his speeches, had a special appeal for Christian conservatives that Cantor lacked.
lead_paragraph: Political analysts and Jewish leaders say Eric Cantor’s Jewish faith did not play a role in his electoral loss. But his opponent, David Brat, had a particular appeal among Christian conservatives.

headline.main: Opponent Resonated With Christian Conservatives in a Way Cantor Could Not
headline.print_headline: Opponent Resonated With Christian Conservatives in a Way Cantor Could Not
